definitions.definition: a part of an area of activity, especially of a country’s economy

examples.text: She works in the **voluntary sector** *(= organizations that do not make a profit)*.
We have seen rapid growth in the **services sector**.
The survey covers a wide range of industry sectors.
the chronic underfunding of the education sector
Increased state investment will lead to more job opportunities in the manufacturing sector.
The largest growth has been in the service sector.

definitions.definition: a part of a particular area, especially an area under military control

examples.text: each sector of the war zone
The partition of the city meant that members of the same family were living in different sectors.
Berlin was divided into four sectors after the war.
Most of the gas will come from the Norwegian sector of the North Sea.

definitions.definition: a part of a circle lying between two straight lines drawn from the centre to the edge

wordOrigin: late 16th cent. (in sense (3)): from late Latin, a technical use of Latin sector ‘cutter’, from sect- ‘cut off’, from the verb secare.
